thread.title: Saraki accepts chief of staff’s resignation
thread.title_full: Saraki accepts chief of staff’s resignation

author: Tony
title: Saraki accepts chief of staff’s resignation
text:
Home » News » Saraki accepts chief of staff’s resignation Saraki accepts chief of staff’s resignation On 10:18 pm In News by Tony Comments 
By Henry Umoru & Joseph Erunke 
ABUJA- SENATE President Bukola Saraki Tuesday thanked his Chief of Staff, Senator Isa Galaudu for working with him. Galaudu 
Senator Galaudu who represented Kebbi North in the 7th Senate, was appointed Chief of Staff by Saraki June 2015, resigned yesterday and in his place Deputy, Hon. Gbenga Makanjuola to act in that position pending the appointment of a substantive Chief of Staff. 
A statement by Saraki’s Special Adviser on Media and Publicity, Yusuph Olaniyonu, read, “senate President, Dr. Abubakar Bukola Saraki has accepted the resignation from office of his Chief of Staff, Senator Isa Galaudu. 
“Galaudu first mentioned his decision to step down for personal reasons last November and that they both agreed on his final exit at the end of January.“Saraki thanked the outgoing Chief of Staff for his commitment and dedication to duty while also directing the Deputy, Hon. Gbenga Makanjuola to act in that position pending the appointment of a substantive Chief of Staff.” Tony
